intro: Polypsecadium tucumanense, commonly known as the Tucumán cactus, is a species of cactus native to Argentina. It is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, demonstrating adaptability to harsh conditions. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable in some regions.
